statements: SELECT * FROM employee_payroll WHERE salary > 50000
SELECT first_name, last_name, salary FROM employee_payroll ORDER BY salary DESC
SELECT * FROM employee_payroll WHERE hire_date BETWEEN '2021-01-01' AND '2021-12-31'
SELECT first_name, last_name, hire_date FROM employee_payroll WHERE salary < 40000 ORDER BY hire_date
SELECT employee_id, first_name, last_name FROM employee_payroll
SELECT first_name, last_name, salary FROM employee_payroll WHERE salary > 50000 ORDER BY salary DESC;
SELECT employee_id, first_name, last_name, hire_date FROM employee_payroll WHERE hire_date > '2020-01-01' ORDER BY hire_date ASC;
SELECT * FROM employee_payroll WHERE first_name LIKE 'J%' AND last_name LIKE 'S%' ORDER BY last_name, first_name;
SELECT employee_id, first_name, last_name, salary FROM employee_payroll WHERE salary BETWEEN 40000 AND 60000 ORDER BY employee_id;
SELECT first_name, last_name, hire_date FROM employee_payroll WHERE hire_date < '2018-01-01' ORDER BY hire_date DESC;
SELECT * FROM employees;
SELECT name, salary FROM employees WHERE department = 'HR';
SELECT employee_id, name, salary FROM employees ORDER BY salary DESC;
SELECT * FROM payroll WHERE pay_date = '2022-01-15';
SELECT employee_id, SUM(hours_worked) AS total_hours_worked FROM payroll GROUP BY employee_id;
SELECT * FROM employees WHERE department='Sales' ORDER BY name ASC;
SELECT employee_id, name, salary FROM employees WHERE salary > 50000 AND department='HR';

SELECT employees.name, payroll.pay_date, payroll.hours_worked, payroll.hourly_rate, payroll.total_pay FROM employees JOIN payroll ON employees.employee_id = payroll.employee_id WHERE employees.department='Engineering';
SELECT employee_id, name, salary, payroll.pay_date, payroll.total_pay FROM employees JOIN payroll ON employees.employee_id = payroll.employee_id ORDER BY salary DESC, payroll.total_pay ASC;
SELECT AVG(salary) AS avg_salary FROM employees GROUP BY department HAVING AVG(salary) > 60000;
SELECT * FROM employee;
SELECT full_name, department FROM employee ORDER BY department DESC;
SELECT COUNT(*) AS total_employees FROM employee;
SELECT full_name, salary FROM employee WHERE salary > 50000;
SELECT employee_id, full_name, department FROM employee WHERE department='HR';
SELECT * FROM employee WHERE department='Sales' ORDER BY full_name DESC;
SELECT full_name, salary FROM employee WHERE salary > 50000;
SELECT * FROM employee JOIN department ON employee.department = department.department_name;
SELECT employee_id, SUM(amount) AS total_salary FROM payroll GROUP BY employee_id HAVING total_salary > 100000;
SELECT department_name, COUNT(*) AS num_employees FROM employee JOIN department ON employee.department = department.department_name GROUP BY department_name ORDER BY num_employees DESC;
SELECT * FROM Employees
SELECT employee_name, employee_position FROM Employees
SELECT department_name FROM Departments
SELECT SUM(net_pay) FROM Payroll
SELECT expense_type, expense_amount FROM Expenses WHERE expense_amount > 1000
SELECT * FROM Employees WHERE employee_position = 'Manager' ORDER BY employee_salary DESC
SELECT employee_name, employee_position, employee_salary FROM Employees WHERE employee_salary > 50000
SELECT department_name, SUM(net_pay) FROM Departments JOIN Payroll ON Departments.department_id = Payroll.employee_id GROUP BY department_name
SELECT employee_name, payroll_date, net_pay FROM Employees JOIN Payroll ON Employees.employee_id = Payroll.employee_id
SELECT expense_type, expense_amount FROM Expenses WHERE expense_amount BETWEEN 1000 AND 5000 ORDER BY expense_amount
SELECT * FROM employees;
SELECT first_name, last_name, salary FROM employees WHERE department = 'IT';
SELECT employee_id, first_name, last_name, salary FROM employees ORDER BY salary DESC;
SELECT department_name, COUNT(*) AS num_employees FROM departments GROUP BY department_name;
SELECT employee_id, SUM(bonus_amount) AS total_bonus FROM bonuses WHERE bonus_date > '2022-01-01';
SELECT * FROM employees WHERE department = 'HR' ORDER BY last_name DESC;
SELECT first_name, last_name, salary FROM employees WHERE salary > 50000;
SELECT department_name, manager_id, location FROM departments WHERE manager_id IS NOT NULL ORDER BY department_name ASC;
SELECT SUM(salary) AS total_salary FROM employees;
SELECT employee_id, bonus_amount, bonus_date FROM bonuses WHERE bonus_amount > 1000 AND bonus_date > '2022-01-01';
